website_summaries.verdict: A good option for customers who prefer a water- and space-saving system and have the patience to wait for the fresh-tasting water to flow.
pros: Offers water-saving technology in a streamlined design that takes up less space than traditional reverse osmosis systems, as the components are organized in an enclosed case
cons: Only has 4-stage filtration, which is less than some others on our list
Flow rate is on the slow side, which may be frustrating for some consumers

customer_reviews.title: Great premium RO system
customer_reviews.text: *Great* reverse osmosis system. The installation was really simple and all of the needed parts and adapters were included. The overall quality feels high, the faucet tee is solid cast metal includes all of the needed gaskets. We installed the system in a house with *rural* Texas well water. The system works great and takes the 450 TDS+ down to ~19 TDS. It also does a great job removing the sulfur/egg smell which creeps in during the height of summer. The only con is the non-standard and expensive Brondell filters. ~$60 USD every 6 months, $80 every 2 years (RO) I'd highly recommend to anyone. Worth the cost, and the quality is pretty high.
customer_reviews.author: kallisti5

customer_reviews.title: Great choice.
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to install, and reduced the hardness of our well water from 230 ppm to 27 ppm--still hard, but not as much. The water tastes good. The spigot has a high arch that works well for filling pots when you turn it toward the counter. The filters are expensive, but are available on Amazon. I like that it is one, self-contained unit that does not have to be mounted under the sink. It does however, take up a large portion of the space under the sink. Double check the dimensions you can use.
customer_reviews.author: S. Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Slow, but easy and effective
customer_reviews.text: This faucet is much slower than my last system that had a bladder, but it doesn't run out like my last one, it just keeps flowing. It is very easy to install and clean and space efficient. Hopefully someday someone can combine this design with a fast flow rate.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: immediate change to my water and simple to install. ...
customer_reviews.text: immediate change to my water and simple to install. Only drawback is the volume of water output which is low due to lack of pump but I did not want a pump and potential leaks, so I am ok with the lower volume
customer_reviews.author: Stingray Dave

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST perfect
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to install. Excellent quality filtration. Quick to fill a container. My only issue with this product is the "indicator light" on the faucet. It seems to be motion or tilt activated which means you're not going to get an accurate measure of filter life. This method means the battery in the handle has to be working with precision. We all know batteries don't do that. I'd recommend some sort of water measuring/counting tool be added.
customer_reviews.author: D Reed

customer_reviews.title: Major, major upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Just installed my new system. What a pleasure to pull out the tangle of tubing for my old system and get rid of the tank. Installation went smoothly. Hook up of the new connections was a breeze. Instructions are very clear. So nice to have a water quality monitor built-in to the faucet. It turns out when you order replacement filters, they include a new battery for the monitor. A superbly engineered integrated filter system. A real step forward.
customer_reviews.author: Lester M. Stacey

customer_reviews.title: "Flow" is just a dribble and will not work with instant hot unit at all
customer_reviews.text: Not only is the flow on cold RO water just a dribble, it won't push ANY water through an instant hot heater. USELESS product unless you are not feeding an instant hot, not feeding an icemaker, and willing to wait forever to fill a glass, let alone a coffee pot. The water flow is one TENTH that of the APEC RO unit I am replacing this one with.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Huie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT CIRCLE IN JULY OF 2017... FLOW OF WATER HAS COME TO A TRICKLE.. I RELIGIOUSLY CHANGE FILTERS ON SCHEDULE,,,, BRONDELL SUPPORT FIRST SAID THEY WOULD SEND ME A NEW UNIT AFTER 20 EMAILS, PURGES , PLUMBING CHANGES ETC.. BRONDELL THEN RENIGGED AND SAID IT WOULD BE 50 $$ .. FILTERS VERY EXPENSIVE STAY AWAY.. I M GETTING ANOTHER BRAND SYSTEM.. AND MIGHT SUE
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and the water tastes great.
customer_reviews.text: Better than the Watts RO that we have had for years. Smaller footprint which is nice and the water tastes great. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is the pressure. I would love to add a T and hook it up to my ice maker but I need a min of 30 PSI and it takes forever to fill a large glass or container. 1st world problems right. HAHAHA I do love that it does not waste as much water. Having to listen to the Watts drain was getting old.
customer_reviews.author: sweetjean

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Good water. Removes the minerals and hardness which saves my espresso machine boiler from scaling. Unfortunately, the output is painfully slow. It takes about 90 seconds to fill a 1⁄2-gallon pitcher. This is a "first world problem" for sure, but you need to know. Requires proprietary filters, but the ease of installation and ease of changing filters, plus the nice form factor, make this a good filter for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miano

customer_reviews.title: It simply works
customer_reviews.text: All is good except for water pressure. Their tech support suggested replacing the filters after only three months of use. There are only two of us and we use this for drinking water, therefore, we were nowhere close to the specified 2500 gallon mark. I replaced the filters and saw no improvement in water flow. I believe this is a common problem with this product as reported by others.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Raissifar

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, simple, easy to install product.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this product in under 30 minutes. I have zero plumbing experience and the setup is incredible simple. I am very happy to start using this system and recommend for anyone who is interested in home water filtration to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Al Long

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions
customer_reviews.text: Like any product that is being used to work with water, read the directions. Hook up the right way and this will make your water taste better and cleaner. No more rural water worries and we believe the filters are doing a good job taking out the chemicals, chlorine, and any other suspensions. Will be changing the filters every 6 months and hope to update this review as we have the filter over the years. Would recommend. The shape of the case just barely fits under our sink so I wish it was an inch or two narrower. Not sure how many other people have that issue with the pipes.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Kuschner

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting in a small space
customer_reviews.text: We installed this in our new home and it took up quite a bit of smaller space compared to the reverse osmosis I had done in our old home. It was very easy to install and we have switched out the filters multiple times since it is about a year old now. The water tastes good and we use it a ton. 3 filters are switched every 6 months (about $70) and the other filter (about $85) once every 2 years. The magnetic "lid" is nice, no worrying about snapping off plastic clips to set into place, great design.
customer_reviews.author: SarahP.

customer_reviews.title: Slow Flow
customer_reviews.text: This unit produces a much slower flow rate than my previous RO system. With the Brondell I only get about 1 liter (4 cups) of water per minute. That's about 75% less than I used to get (15 seconds vs. 1 minute). When I spoke to customer service, they said that one cup in 15 seconds was about average. I'll keep the system but I think Brondell should include that flow rate information in their description. I will say that their customer service is excellent - and I'd rate them 5 stars on that.
customer_reviews.author: Santa Fean

customer_reviews.title: Easy DiY installation, Compact, and Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this was definitely the easiest DIY installation I’ve ever done. The instructions were clear and easy to follow and understand and the video on the website was a big help as well. All the parts you need are included for a worry free install. The compact design makes for an easy fit leaving ample room to spare for under sink storage. The initial purge of the system takes about an hour before you can use the system but after that it’s care free from there.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah van der Linden

customer_reviews.title: So far so great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! So worth the money! It's so easy to install with the right tools and a little know how. It installs just like the video says. Works great! Water is delicious! It's so awesome to not have to lug water containers anymore! For people who complain about how the water pressure is low. This is the way that it's supposed to work. All of these systems have very low pressure and take a while to fill up your glass. It can be a little frustrating at times but aside from that, it's so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Perez

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: We moved to a property that had some questionable water...our dog wouldn't even drink it! Purchased this immediately and we felt comfortable enough to drink the water for a few months (until we moved). Install 'seemed' a bit confusing but luckily someone installed for us so I can't accurately rate that portion. Actually wished I could take this with me, but we ended up leaving it for the next tenants to use instead (also, didn't feel like going through the headache of trying to take out). GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: J. Costanzo

customer_reviews.title: the water actually tastes sweet. I bought the water tester and it was ...
customer_reviews.text: i waited to see if it work for a couple months now. OMG, they were right, the water actually tastes sweet. I bought the water tester and it was almost as clean as distill water. reasonable price for great quality water. 100% recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: Great design, could have better flow and filtration.
customer_reviews.text: Sleek space saving design. Frees up a lot of space under sink. Installation was the simplest of all RO units I've installed. Downsides include slow flow from the faucet and the filtration is not as good as other traditional units. I tested the water with a TDS tester. Unfiltered water registers around 160 TDS, after filtration, TDS is around 15. Other traditional units typically get the TDS down around 5, even if the prefiltered water is in the 300-400 range. Also a little more expensive than other units that filter better but take up more space.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Mather

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting water. EASY install!
customer_reviews.text: Out last home had an Osmosis filter and we loved it. When we moved into our new home we wanted another one but were a bit scared of the install. The cabinet under the sink didn't have a lot of room and my husband does not like to touch anything plumbing related. We were spending a fortune on bottled water and came across this. It looked very easy to install so we decided to give it a try. My husband had it installed in about 2 hours and the water is delicious. We have never had a problem with the tank running empty. It is perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cavanagh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I previously wrote a bad review because I incorrectly calculated Amazon charged me double the tax. I was wrong and I notified Amazon. So, here's the real review... My doctor recommended this RO filter, he has it in his office which gave me an opportunity to evaluate. I did some research and found it delivers what it promises, excellent tasting water, minimum waste, integrated package, easy to replace filters and very easy to install. I also got my filer within days of my order and that is amazing. It was very easy to install and I'm really pleased with the results. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: xlujan

customer_reviews.title: Better performance than the competition
customer_reviews.text: This RO unit is small, self-contained and works as advertised. I replaced a Watts RO unit that was underperforming. As a rough measure of water quality. My Total Dissolved Solids is now the low 40's compared to about 500 without filtration. With the Watts unit, I had never got below 250 even with a new RO membrane.
customer_reviews.author: RONAA

customer_reviews.title: Pressure sucks, now leaking
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for the unit. New house, loved the design, even spent extra $75 on the brushed nickel faucet. Pressure sucks! Bought a pressure gauge and pressure going into house is 65psi. Thought maybe pressure to outlet under sink was bad. Bought a gauge to check....65psi. Used same gauge to check outlet pressure....25. It is a fast trickle. Now it is leaking like a siv. Amazon is sending a replacement, let’s hope it is better
customer_reviews.author: Erik B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Filter System
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable replacement water filter system for the countertop model we had. This model was highly rated, well priced, and also designed to minimize waste water. There is also no additional pump to mess with. Although I was hesitant about drilling a hole in my drain line, the installation instructions were clear and simple. I had one minor question for technical support. They responded much more quickly than I expected. The filtered water clarity and taste are exceptional. I would recommend this system to anyone who wants healthier and better tasting water!
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Barnhouse

customer_reviews.title: Good water purifier if it can fit and be easily installed
customer_reviews.text: We really like the taste of the water through this. We did have to call a plumber and pay $400 to install it as our place apparently had old pipes. We drilled the hole in the sink on our own for the purifier faucet . The purifier itself takes a lot of space under the sink though. But overall we are happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SLI.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, looks good but overpriced with limited water storage.  Still good water.
customer_reviews.text: I very much like the way it is packaged and the ease of installation. It is overpriced for what you get but, in ,my case, the form factor was worth a few extra dollars. With that said, I see the price has increased by ~$50.00 and it's simply not worth the $300.00 current price. Let's face it, there is minimal performance difference between the least expensive RO system and the most expensive. Overall, it produces good water and that's what I was looking for. Biggest downside besides the price is limited water storage but that can be solved by adding a second storage tank if it becomes a significant issue. I would recommend the unit but with some reservations.
customer_reviews.author: Bluwtr49

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working well, very easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Th installation took me about 20 minutes, very easy with detailed instructions. The PPM on my TDS meter went from about 450 down to 50(I'm on city water). This is good enough for my purposes. hopefully the unit holds up and the filter changes go equally as good. I do wish they had some options for different dispenser types/colors(brushed, bronze, etc.). Overall, very happy with the unit and it is much cleaner looking than similar products.
customer_reviews.author: SavageMN

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. My husband and I did it. Well I did everything but drill into the pipe. My 3 year old could have installed this. Water quality is pretty good. I filter again with a pitcher in the fridge but not necessary. Wish it was a little cheaper. Quality of water doesn’t seem much different than my old system that was only $100. Not much of a space saver either but looks great. Came with everything you needed too.
customer_reviews.author: Briana s.

customer_reviews.title: Water flow is maddenly slow
customer_reviews.text: Cannot recommend this product, unless your time is not worth anything to you.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product for an apartment
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product for an apartment, i had to install it without the face-plate on so that it will fit behind the pee trap and that i can access the filters for replacement. only downside is that there is not a built in timer to buzz and let me know when its time to replace the filters, but i can find something to do that for me. with the correct part, instillation is remarkably easy where you must have an air-gap. search for "WaterGap Combination Air Gap And Water Dispensing Faucet" install took 45 minutes, i love having this filter unit and am extremely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Henz

customer_reviews.title: Quick and efficient
customer_reviews.text: We've had this system for over two years and it's still going strong. It doesn't take much time to fill up a jug and the water tastes great. This one works so much better than the RO system my parents have which always needs lots of time to filter more water.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Compact, and efficient RO filter system!!
customer_reviews.text: The Brondell RO filter system was a perfect addition to my new cabin. I'm on a septic system and wanted a good filter system that wouldn't waste a lot of treated water. The system was an easy installation, and fit under my compact sink cabinet like a charm! No leak problems, and great service and shipping!
customer_reviews.author: yawnny

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase. This unit is a bit more expensive ...
customer_reviews.text: Good purchase. This unit is a bit more expensive than some others but I bought this unit mainly because of the water savings compared to some other ro systems. It was a piece of cake to install and looks nice under my sink. The unit so far is performing well, it took my tap water from 442 tds to 9. The water tastes great.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Delivery was spot on and the seller was great. The unit installed in 30 minutes (I'm a ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was spot on and the seller was great. The unit installed in 30 minutes (I'm a plumber) and had all the parts plus a shutoff to easily install. Water tastes good.
customer_reviews.author: Baldy

customer_reviews.title: Slow piece to run down water
customer_reviews.text: This product runs slowly. Price is high for the item. I have set this up and assembled it in my house so will not be taking it off due to the amount of time and effort it took me to set up. I’m stuck with this piece which is slow.
customer_reviews.author: Sukhpreet

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting water and easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a compact, well designed water purifier that can handle hard water. Had two failed attempts (cuckoo, frizzlife) at buying a water purifier prior to ordering the brondell. This unit was easy to install, had a very thorough manual, looks great, and most importantly produces great tasting water. Also a main factor was that the company had a long history of delivering quality products. - TDS reduction from 260 -> 18. - Runs silently - Installation was easy. - Expect a bigger unit than what it looks in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Jin Hyun

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and organized
customer_reviews.text: Have not had a RO system before. This unit caught my attention mainly because everything is contained and does not require any mounting. The directions are easy to follow, installed the system in under 30 minutes. I see a few reviews complaining about the flow, we are not experiencing anything with this. I don't if they are having water pressure issues or if we just aren't as picky but we have no issues with the water flow. No complaints at all with the operation of the unit. Replacement filters are a little more expensive than other but for me its worth it mainly because of how simple the system is.
customer_reviews.author: Josh P

customer_reviews.title: Compact and effective
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I replaced a popular highly rated RO system with this one. The other one was a rats nest of tubes and filters under my sink. This one was extremely simple to setup. The flow rate is much better. TDS are about 1/4 as much as the other unit (could be partly do the fact that it is new - I think that the RO membrane on the other unit needed to be replaced). Overall an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: RSH

customer_reviews.title: Ok deal
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this delivered yesterday so it's a little early for a comprehensive review, however it was fairly easy to install and the water tastes fine. Do not expect much pressure from the faucet,more of a strong dribble. It takes a bit to fill a gallon container. It does seem to regenerate the aforementioned gallon in about 40 minutes or so. That is on water pressure of 80 pounds. Longevity unknown at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ezey to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Great tasting water. Installed in Salem Oregon high colorin and Algee bloom. System works great. Filters are very ezey to change. This is a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Garey C.

customer_reviews.title: it's ok
customer_reviews.text: The spout pours slooooooow. It's the main down side. When you want a tall glass of water you want it to fill fast. This one is VERY slow. I feel like I stand there forever just to get a glass of water. Our last one was much faster. Water does taste great.
customer_reviews.author: mom to many

customer_reviews.title: Great drinking water, at last!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this system on the advice of our son who installed one a year ago. While you do have to understand that water pressure on your main kitchen faucet remans the same, the pressure is going to be be a bit different (slower) with this system, but it is well worth that small adjustment to have wonderful, clear, healthy drinking water at your fingertips!
customer_reviews.author: Christine E.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for icemaker about 20 feet from the system
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried about whether or not this system would have enough pressure to push filtered water to my fridge which is about 20 feet of 1/4" tubing away but it works! I have the system under the sink with a T to the included faucet close to the sink and the other end going to the fridge. Ice is now produced with the filtered water without issue. I still use the faucet to fill the cup as it is 2x faster than the fridge water due to the distance and rise that the water to the fridge has to endure. All in all very happy with this system.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Not My First RO Unit
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few brands of reverse osmosis units but this is the best I've had. It takes up less space and works great. Filters are easy to change and the box that holds everything looks better under the sink than the filters and tank would.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Tasty well water!
customer_reviews.text: I have never been able to drink my well water. It has a horrible after taste even through a filter. I no longer buy bottled water at the store. This system makes the water amazingly clean and I hope it lasts me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: KAAcosta

customer_reviews.title: Great value RO
customer_reviews.text: Have very hard water that was killing coffee maker, leaving rings on pots and clogging kettle. Was easy to install, came with all the parts and very efficient. Only complaint is that water has a slight metallic taste. Would buy again under same circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install to works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product has been installed for about 2 months and we love it!!!! The water is clean and there is no bulky unit in our kitchen. The installation was fairly easy for a handy gal. I did have to re-work some of the plumbing under the sink to fit the filters in but no need to pay anyone skilled. Love that electricity is not needed. Very satisfied with this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Hirmel Colon

customer_reviews.title: Big Improvement n Taste from regular faucet water
customer_reviews.text: At first the taste of the Brondell filtered water tasted a little too much on the sweet side but now I am used to it. I have a question, though, about my overall Brondell filtered water consumption. Is it better to use up every day the 2 1/2 gallons of water so it gets replaced more regularly in the tank? I probably use more in the line of 1 gallon daily.
customer_reviews.author: Helga

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation and Compact design
customer_reviews.text: Easy Install , Compact, no leaks, water taste not as sweet as I expected like other RO systems. System is expensive almost double than the one I bought eBay. Last RO system from express water was cheaper and better water taste. Reason I bought this one is due to compact design and hopefully drains less water compared to other systems.
customer_reviews.author: Pokiri

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact unit.
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit for under cabinet use in a home where heavy demand wont drain it. We use it mostly for coffee and drinking water in a three member house and never run out of processed water.
customer_reviews.author: Huntindawg

customer_reviews.title: Love this water system!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this water system; it was easy to install and we love the taste of the water; just wish I bought one sooner! We never want to be without this system!!! We miss it terribly when we are on vacation!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace an old system we had when the bladder in the tank went bad. We like very much. Much better pressure than the one we had. Water tastes very good. Hope it keeps going as good as it is.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Very good filter
customer_reviews.text: Best thing about this filter is that it is very compact and saves space under your sink. It will easily fit tight spaces and leave plenty of space left under the sink. Performance wise, it works as great as other filters in the market. One small disadvantage is that it doesn't have pressurized tank, which means the water pressure from the chrome faucet is not great. It takes about 10 seconds to fill a 250 ml glass.
customer_reviews.author: Kamal Tiwari

customer_reviews.title: Big space saver too!
customer_reviews.text: Such a space saver... I have owned many RO’s, including on boats, and this one of the BEST, especially for the price. Walk up stupid to install and maintain, it’s all color coded.. Not as much pressure as the old models, but I'll take it!
customer_reviews.author: Daveh777

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Water tastes great! Nice that it is so small under the sink. Not a million cords and tanks visible. Would recommend! (Old Culligan lover and it definitely compares!)
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The only reverse osmosis filter that fit under my sink. The 1.25 gallons every 40 mins is more than adequate. I tested the water quality and my tap water measures at 207 ppm but only at 16 ppm with the Brondell Circle.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: We paid for a professional installation because of the need to cut a hole in the granite countertop. It works great and is exactly what we were expecting. water tastes good and we are very pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Elterman

customer_reviews.title: EASY INSTALL!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVED THE PRODUCT! I AM TOTALLY SATISFIED WITH THE PRODUCT. WATER TASES GREAT, DOES'NT HAVE THAT PLASTIC TASTE THAT YOU GET WITH BOTTLED WATER. THE INSTALLATION WAS THE EASIEST (WATCH THE INSTALLATION VIDEO). I AM NOT MECHANICALLY INCLINED AND I HAD IT INSTALLED IN 40 MINUTES WITH NO PROBLEM.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Richie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The unit was easy to install. Seems very efficient with water waste. Tastes clean and refreshing. Would recommend to others looking for a compact RO unit.
customer_reviews.author: Eric F.

customer_reviews.title: Great under counter RO system
customer_reviews.text: This system was easy to install. Replaced old tank system. Compact and easy to change filters. Never runs out of water. Downside of not having pressure tank is slower fill times but difference is few seconds. Great to have more space under sink.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, compact and clean
customer_reviews.text: Perfect with easy set up! Takes up less room than the last RO systems we have had with 3 canister and water system. Worth the extra money just for ease of installation!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit so far. Sleek look, love the encapsulated parts, for the most part was an easy install, no issues with the unit so far. Very happy and love the peace of mind knowing I’m drinking clean water.
customer_reviews.author: J. Willetts

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy Installation and Super Tasting Water!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were very clear and installed DIY in under an hour. The design is very thoughtful and user-friendly, and I was surprised by the thoroughness of the step-by-step instructions. It fit compactly under the sink and takes up very little room. Installed it yesterday and are enjoying clear, clean water today! Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: John Mucha

customer_reviews.title: Love This SMALL Profile RO System
customer_reviews.text: I have a vacation home that is very tiny with a matching very tiny wet bar. Most RO systems won't fit. This one did, was installed in minutes and works perfectly. The flow rate is a little slower than some other but per
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price! Quality water
customer_reviews.text: Had this system a little over a year, very happy, ppm rate is as low as my $2500.00 r.o. system in other house. Thanks so much.
customer_reviews.author: Mandie

customer_reviews.title: Great self contain filtration System
customer_reviews.text: Great self contain filtration System easy to install easy to operated great solution.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lorenzana

customer_reviews.title: From 280ppm to 19ppm. 60 Minute Installation, Daily satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Refills super fast. Love everything about this machine. Knock on wood, but no leaks so far. 1/2" diamond drill bit got the hole cut out for my granite, and I was in business.
customer_reviews.author: trnx7717

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves how this water tastes!

customer_reviews.title: Slow water flow, not worth the time and effort.

The water it produces has an excellent taste, or lack of taste. It is a relief to know at least we are removing some toxins from our daily lives. I am online today to replace the filter, and hoping this continues to be an efficient expenditure.....
customer_reviews.author: Pixiewings37

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes good

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of installation, as close to plug and play as it gets for a filtration system. Very compact and fits underneath my sink. The other major upsides, and the reason I purchased this system, is that it is quiet - no more gurgling sounds as the reverse osmosis purifies more water. And as promised, this system seems much more efficient and I'm confident the ROI is good.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Powell

customer_reviews.title: Be aware that you need to have a hole in your countertop, or you need to drill a hole.
customer_reviews.text: This may be a good product, but it does require having a hole in your countertop. I would have been required to drill a hole in my granite countertop. I can't do this. I was told the filter is very easy to install, but I was not aware of this particular requirement.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Krupa

customer_reviews.title: Great system.
customer_reviews.text: A little slower than my old RO system but hardly noticeable. Great taste and parts per million numbers in the 30s which is verifiable y good. Plus I like the light indicator for filter change time.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install compact unit.
customer_reviews.text: This product replaced an old Sear unit. The self contained single unit Brondell takes up much less space. The water quality it great.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Pechuekonis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and space saving design

My only complaint is that I wish it had higher output pressure for my refrigerator or even a air inlet to increase it. The faucet has good pressure. Would recommend. Update, had over a year and have replaced all the filters on time as directions state and have SUPER SLOW flow. At times will trickle for over 30 seconds.
